history.content: Don't do triple major in CS+Econ+Haas. There is just no point in doing Econ and Haas together IMO. Econ should be a backup major if you don't get into Haas and at the end of the day, business people generally don't care about your major as long as your story makes sense. If I were in your shoes, I would pick CS70, UGBA10, COMPLIT20 and ECON100A and leave out CS61C because generally 61C has been considered a "not so useful" course by many people and it does take up a chunk of time. EE16A does have a bit of workload and you wouldn't want to be playing with that if you are doing pre-reqs for other majors at the same time. BTW, wasn't Haas decision already posted?

children.subject: Also, is EE16A supposed to be easier if you have taken Math 54?

16A would be easier if you have taken 54 but it does have circuit components in it and have a HUGE lab time commitment. So weigh those factors in and see if you can handle it. If you are getting A-'s or better in 54, then the linear algebra part of 16A should be nothing.
Haas decisions were posted for the Class of 2019. 2020 students apply next year.

history.content:
Hi,

I am planning to double major in Computer Science and Economics (with an option to triple major if I get into Haas). I will have done most of the requirements for the Econ major by sophomore year but I have 1 lower div prerequisite (CS70) and and 2 lower div requirements (EE16A, CS61C) left. 

I could take CS61C and CS70 together, but I am not sure whether the workload would be manageable since I would be taking COMPLIT 20 and UGBA 10 alongside them. I would have to split my time evenly between 61C, 70 and UGBA 10 since the first two are major requirements and the latter is a Haas pre-requisite. 

Additional course options include CS70/61C, UGBA10, COMPLIT20, and the last of my Econ requirements (i.e., a course in the Econ 100 series) or CS70/61C, UGBA10, COMPLIT20 and EE16A. What would be better in terms of general workload? For reference, I am currently taking Math 54, Econ-2 and CS61A this semester and it has not been easy for me at all.
